bayou.bytes

Class RangedByteSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.bytes.RangedByteSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteSource

    public class RangedByteSource
extends Object
implements ByteSource
    A sub-range [min, max) of an origin source.

    The `min` limit is inclusive. The `max` limit is exclusive.

    For example, an origin source contains 10 bytes {b0, ..., b9}. The sub-range [min=3, max=8) will contain 5 bytes {b3, ..., b7}.

    Both `min` and `max` can go beyond the range of the origin source. If the origin source contains 10 bytes, sub-range [3, Long.MAX_VALUE) is valid, containing 7 bytes; sub-range [10, 20) is also valid, containing 0 bytes.

    This class uses the skip(n) method on the origin source. Note that `origin.skip(n)` does not need to actually skip n bytes; this class can skip the origin by read and discard bytes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RangedByteSource

        public RangedByteSource(ByteSource origin,
                        long min,
                        long max)
        Create a sub-range [min, max) of the origin source.

        Required: 0<=min<=max.

        Note that it is legal if max>=L or min>=L where L is the length of the origin source.

        public long skip(long n)
          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                 IllegalStateException
        Try to skip forward `n` bytes.
        Specified by:
        skip in interface ByteSource
        Parameters:
        n - number of bytes to skip; n >= 0.
        Returns:
        number of bytes (m) actually skipped. 0 <= m <= n.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this source is closed.
        IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0.
